question: The take-off distance available is?

choices.choice: The total runway length, without clearway even if this one exists.
The length of the take-off run available plus any length of clearway available, up to a maximum of 50% of TORA.
The runway length minus stopway.
The runway length plus of the clearway.

subject: Performance

question: The TODA is:

choices.choice: Declared runway length only.
Declared runway length plus clearway.
Declared runway length plus stopway.
Declared runway length plus clearway and stopway.

subject: Performance

question: VR (Rotation Speed) is the speed at which:

choices.choice: The aeroplane nose wheel is off the ground.
The pilot initiate the action required to raise the nose wheel off the ground.
The main wheels lift off the ground
The aeroplane rotates about the longitudinal axis.

subject: Performance

question: During take-off, the thrust of a fixed pitch propeller:

choices.choice: increases slightly while the aeroplane speed builds up
varies with mass changes only.
has no change during take-off and climb.
decreases while the aeroplane speed builds up.

subject: Performance

question: Other factors remaining constant and not limiting, how does increasing pressure altitude affect allowable takeoff mass?

choices.choice: Allowable take-off mass remains uninfluenced up to 5000 ft pressure altitude.
Allowable take-off mass decreases.
Allowable take-off mass increases.
There is no effect on allowable take-off mass

subject: Performance

question: What is the effect of a contaminated runway on the take-off?

choices.choice: Increases the take-off distance and greatly increases the accelerate stop distance.
Increases the take-off distance and decreases the accelerate stop distance.
Decreases the take-off distance and increases the accelerate stop distance.
Decreases the take-off distance and greatly decreases the accelerate stop distance.

subject: Performance

question: The stopway is an area which allows an increase only in:

choices.choice: the accelerate - stop distance available
the take-off run available.
the take-off distance available.
the landing distance available.

subject: Performance

question: How is wind considered in the take-off performance data of the Aeroplane Operations Manuals?

choices.choice: Unfactored headwind and tailwind components are used.
Not more than 80% headwind and not less than 125% tailwind.
Since take-offs with tailwind are not permitted, only headwinds are considered
Not more than 50% of a headwind and not less than 150% of the tailwind.

subject: Performance

question: During take-off:

choices.choice: The acceleration force decreases.
Wheel drag increases.
Thrust increases
Total drag decreases

subject: Performance

question: Which class of aeroplane describes all multi-engine turbo-jet aeroplanes?

choices.choice: Unclassified.
Class C.
Class B.
Class A.

subject: Performance

question: High altitudes, hot air and humid conditions will:

choices.choice: Increase the take-off payload.
Decrease the take-off mass.
Increase the take-off performance
Decrease the take-off distance.

subject: Performance

question: The take-off distance of an aircraft is 800m in a standard atmosphere with no wind and at 0 ft pressure altitude. Using the following corrections: ± 20 m / 1 000 ft field elevation – 5 m / kt headwind + 10 m / kt tail wind ± 15 m / % runway slope ± 5 m / °C deviation from standard temperature The take-off distance from an airport at 2 000 ft elevation, temperature 21°C, QNH 1013.25 hPa, 2% up-slope, 5 kt tail wind is:
subject: Performance

question: An airport has a 3000 metres long runway, and a 2000 meter clearway at each end of that runway. For the calculation of the maximum allowed take-off mass, the take-off distance available cannot be greater than:

choices.choice: 4000 metres
3000 metres
5000 metres
4500 metres

subject: Performance

question: The take-off distance available is:

choices.choice: the total runway length, without clearway even if this one exists.
the length of the take-off run available plus the length of the clearway available.
the runway length minus stopway.
the runway length plus half of the clearway.

subject: Performance

question: In reality, the net thrust of a jet engine at constant RPM:

choices.choice: does not change with changing altitude.
is independent of the airspeed.
decreases with the airspeed.
increases with the airspeed.

subject: Performance

question: Which of the following are to be taken into account for the runway in use for take-off?

choices.choice: Airport elevation, runway slope, standard temperature, pressure altitude and wind components.
Airport elevation, runway slope, outside air temperature, standard pressure and wind components.
Airport elevation, runway slope, outside air temperature, pressure altitude and wind components.
Airport elevation, runway slope, standard temperature, standard pressure and wind components.

subject: Performance

question: The gross take-off distance (TOD) is defined as being from brake release until:

choices.choice: The aeroplane's main wheel lifts off the runway.
The aeroplane has reached 35 ft.
The aeroplane has reached the screen height.
The aeroplane is safely off the ground.

subject: Performance

question: A ‘Balanced Field Length’ is said to exist where:

choices.choice: The accelerate stop distance available is equal to the take-off distance available.
The clearway does not equal the stopway.
The accelerate stop distance is equal to the all engine take-off distance.
The one engine out take-off distance is equal to the all engine take-off distance.

subject: Performance

question: Can a clearway be used in the accelerate stop distance calculations?

choices.choice: Yes
No
Only if the clearway is shorter than the stopway
Only if there is no clearway.

subject: Performance

question: What will be the effect on an aeroplane’s performance if aerodrome pressure altitude is decreased?

choices.choice: It will increase the take-off distance required
It will increase the take-off ground run.
It will decrease the take-off distance required.
It will increase the accelerate stop distance.

subject: Performance

question: An uphill slope:

choices.choice: increases the take-off distance more than the accelerate stop distance.
decreases the accelerate stop distance only.
decreases the take-off distance only.
increases the allowed take-off mass.

subject: Performance

question: For a take-off in slush, the slush drag:

choices.choice: Will increase up to aquaplane speed and then remain constant
Will increase up to aquaplane speed and then decrease
Will increase up to aquaplane speed and then increase at a greater rate.
Will decrease progressively up to the lift off speed.

subject: Performance

question: The main purpose for taking off into wind is to:

choices.choice: Decrease the true ground speed.
Decrease the aeroplane performance.
Increase the true ground speed.
Increase the take-off distance.

subject: Performance

question: In relation to runway strength, the ACN:

choices.choice: Must not exceed 90% of the PCN and then only if special procedures are followed
May exceed the PCN by up to 10% or 50 % if special procedures are followed
May exceed the PCN by a factor of 2
Must equal the PCN

subject: Performance

question: What will be the influence on the aeroplane performance if aerodrome pressure altitude is increased?

choices.choice: It will increase the take-off distance.
It will decrease the take-off distance.
It will increase the take-off distance available.
It will increase the accelerate stop distance available.

subject: Performance

question: The required Take-off Distance (TOD) and the field length limited Take-off Mass (TOM) are different for the zero flap case and take-off position flap case. What is the result of flap setting in take-off position compared to zero flap position?

choices.choice: Increased TOD required and decreased field length limited TOM.
Increased TOD required and increased field length limited TOM.
Decreased TOD required and decreased field length limited TOM.
Decreased TOD required and increased field length limited TOM.

subject: Performance

question: With contamination on the aircraft wings and fuselage only:

choices.choice: The TODR will be unaffected.
The ASDR will decrease.
Stalling speed is not affected
The lift off speed will be increased.

subject: Performance

question: Can the length of a stopway be added to the runway length to determine the take-off distance available?

choices.choice: Yes, but the stopway must be able to carry the weight of the aeroplane.
Yes, but the stopway must have the same width as the runway.
No
No, unless its centreline is on the extended centreline of the runway.

subject: Performance

question: A propeller aeroplane with nine or less passenger seats and with a maximum take-off mass of 5700 kg or less is described as:

choices.choice: Unclassified.
Class C.
Class B.
Class A.

subject: Performance

question: Take-off distance available is?

choices.choice: Take-off run available plus clearway
Take-off run minus the clearway, even if clearway exists
Always 1.5 times the TORA.
50% of the TORA.

subject: Performance

question: The stopway is:

choices.choice: at least as wide as the runway.
no less than 152 wide.
no less than 500 ft wide.
as strong as the main runway.

subject: Performance
